Comments_List: This course helped me discover my interest in American political thought.

This course is mainly focused on the works by Tocqueville, which makes it possible for us to understand his point of departure and observe how his thinking has changed over time. Professor Garsten makes sure that a reasonable amount of reading is assigned for each session so that we could engage with the texts carefully. It would be nice if we could start the class discussions with a passage from the book or questions from the students.

Those who have enjoyed the directed studies might finds this course a nice extension. Otherwise, this course is still worth taking for all Americans, for people who do not know much or have strong opinions about democracy, and for those with a general interest in political thought or intellectual history.
